Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous material, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now worn and faded in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.196)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36499) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36499)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 341 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13545 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
